thread.title: Horse patrol embraces the Super Bowl's festive spirit -- with dancing

author: chron.com
title: Horse patrol embraces the Super Bowl's festive spirit -- with dancing

Image 1 of 42 The mounted patrol from the Houston Police Department had a good time during Super Bowl week. The mounted patrol of the Houston Police Department had a good time during Super Bowl week. Horses and riders took part in pictures and, most notably, dancing. less The mounted patrol from the Houston Police Department had a good time during Super Bowl week. Horses and riders took ... more Photo: Facebook/Houston Police Mounted Patrol Image 2 of 42 Cha-cha-cha Riders in the Houston Police Department's mounted patrol led a line of horses in dancing to ZZ Top songs while working Super Bowl weekend. Photo: Facebook/Houston Police Mounted Patrol Image 3 of 42 Left, right, left Horses from Houston Police's mounted patrol took part in a sort of line dancing on Feb. 4, 2017. It was part of a week of work and fun for the officers and the horses. Left, right, left Horses from Houston Police's mounted patrol took part in a sort of line dancing on Feb. 4, 2017. It was part of a week of work and fun for the officers and the horses. Photo: Elizabeth Conley/Houston Chronicle Image 42 of 42 Horse patrol embraces the Super Bowl's festive spirit -- with dancing 1 / 42 Back to Gallery While patrolling massive events around Super Bowl LI, it turns out our local police officers -- at least those on horseback -- aren't afraid to have a little fun, too.
ZZ Top performed to an at-capacity crowd Saturday night at Discovery Green, part of the programming for Super Bowl Live. As the music reverberated through the air, seven officers on their horses did a little dancing of their own.
Line dancing, in fact.
SHOWTIME: Fans pour into Houston as Super Bowl kickoff nears
The Houston Mounted Patrol members moved right, left, back, and forward to the cheers of the crowd in a parking lot. The center officer raises his arms triumphantly at the end. On Sunday morning, they posted the video to Facebook .
It wasn't the first bit of dancing the team had done this week.
The trend began Feb. 1, with a video posted of an officer on a white horse doing a routine of her own, inventing moves as music pounds in the background.
SPIRITUAL THOUGHTS: Pope Francis has message for Super Bowl in Houston
Her fellow officer, in a video posted minutes later, tries to counter her in a dance-off.
Viewers decided he lost. The award for his partner? A trophy and bragging rights.
Intel Buffalo Wild Wings Kia Motors America Wix.com Skittles USA Mr. Clean
